data.title: Clinical Guides at Monash Health
data.meta_description: Clinical Guides: Nursing Times User Guide: User Guide
data.text:
Find instructions below on how to create a shortcut to Nursing Times on your Apple device below:

Open up 'Safari' on your phone

Go to https://www.nursingtimes.net/

Click on the 'share' icon on your Safari browser

Click 'Add to Home Screen' > Type in a label > Click Add

Find instructions below on how to create a shortcut to Nursing Times on your Android device below:

Open up 'Chrome' on your phone

Go to https://www.nursingtimes.net/

Click on the 'menu' icon (the three dots)

Click 'Add to Home Screen' > Type in a label > Click Add

Searching

Ask Nursing Times is a search engine where you can ask questions and receive AI generated answers based on articles by experts.

General Search

There is a general search bar at the top right hand side of the page. Type a search term into the bar and click enter. Alternatively, click the search icon to bring up a dedicated search page.

Once a search term is entered, the search can be refined using the filters on the left hand side. These filters are:

Article type (opinion, news, clinical)

Clinical subject (Healthcare, Cancer, Leadership etc.)

Roles and setting (Hospital nurses, Practice nurses, Mental health nurses etc.)

Date range

News

Explore the news section of Nursing Times for all the latest news on nursing and the health and social care system more generally, with analysis, interviews, investigations and news listed by category. Click here to read more.

Clinical

The Clinical section of the website includes a range of articles, Journal Club, Self-Assessment, Practical Procedures and Systems of Life. There is also a monthly You're the Panel Series. This details a real-life case heard by the Nursing and Midwifery Council's fitness to practise panel. Click here to explore more.

Journal

Explore the Nursing Times archive going back to 1905. Discover how nursing has changed over the decades.

CPD

Nursing Times CPD provides support for your professional development revalidation.

Enter Nursing Times CPD Zone here
